summary: The No Tax on Overtime for All Workers Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a tax deduction for certain overtime compensation. It defines "qualified overtime compensation" as exceeding the regular rate under the Fair Labor Standards Act, or exceeding the regular rate based on pre-arranged agreements between employees and employers, with specific conditions depending on the type of work and relevant labor agreements. The amendment would apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
